Job Description:
Warehouse Management

• Effectively manage warehouse inspection, delivery functions and management plan by developing schedule, procedures, and policy in compliance with company’s policies and objectives.
• Work closely with relevant department to cope materials/resources and to ensure that they are avail timely supplied to construction site when needed.
• Conduct monthly inventory and report warehouse activities and stock movement line manager to avoid stock lose or variance.
• Entry data into SAP system and review other expenditure documents from related departments.
• Supervise, train, coach, and discipline staffs to strengthen warehouse management and ensure high productivity and staff morale.
• Categorize type of materials/resources.

Admin Management

• Supervise team members to enforce the office policies and procedures established by company.
• Monitor and support daily operational needs.
• Control staff attendance, stationery and office supply and machinery.
• Supervise, monitor, and maintain company’s properties.
• Manage, control, and safeguard the physical fixed asset items of Company as per company policies and procedures.
• Manage record and oversee all transactions tracked related to the company's fixed assets, materials and resources including movement, tagging, or labeling of the items.
• Maintain accuracy of all counts and ensure authenticity of all information.
•  Perform other tasks as per assigned by line manager.
Job Requirement:
Education/Experience: 
• Bachelor’s degree in Business Admin or related field.
• Proven at least 5 years’ working experience in warehouse and admin from real estate or construction company. 
• Knowledge of logistics and warehouse management system.
• Good communication (Khmer and English), diplomatic and organizational skills.
• Ability to work under pressure and with personnel from all levels.
• Tact and the ability to deal with difficult situations.
• Good knowledge of different business functions.
• Meticulous attention to detail.
• Good morale and integrity.

Job Description:
- Manage staff schedule for production runs, ensure adequate raw materials are available, and make sure all the equipment is working correctly.
- Lead safety program, assure all employees are fully trained and continually monitor employees to verify that all safety policies and procedures are in compliance.
- Direct all brewery operations and personnel within designated process segment. Includes planning and scheduling activities and personnel to meet brewery packaging schedule.
- Manage the financial performance in designated process segment and identifying and driving production efficiency and quality improvements to meet challenging targets.
- Work with Automation Team to improve efficiencies of sequences and processes.
- Work with Maintenance department to identify critical maintenance and repairs, schedule, support and execute fixes and upgrades. Work with Reliability Engineer to optimize PM frequency as well as establish new PMs.
- Identify and projects that deliver quality-focused process improvements.
- Coordinate all capital work in designated process segment including testing, startup, training and SOP updates/
creation.
- Maintain a safe, healthy and risk-free work environment.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor of Brewing Science, Food Science and Technology, Chemistry
- IBD Diploma in Brewing (or equivalent) is preferred
- 5+ years production brewery experience in Brewing Management
- Excellent communication & interpersonal skills
- Committed to business's strategic & analytical skill
- Strong leader with conflict resolution

Interested candidates, please submit your Cover Letter & CVs with recent photo, salary expectation to the following email or address:
* Phone/Telegram : 010 664 988
* Email : hr@vattanacbrewery.com
* Address : Vattanac Capital Tower – Level 8, # 66, Preah Monivong Blvd, Sangkat Wat Phnom, Khan Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.
* Website : www.vattanacbrewery.com
All application documents will be treated confidentially and will not be returned.  Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Job Description: o The Supervisor Supply Planning is responsible for all supply planning of beer production by translating Demand Plan into Distribution, Production, Materials and Packaging Requirementso Responsible for Planning and creating production schedule to ensure no Out of Stock and optimize plan capacity. o To ensure safety stock is planned to avoid Out of Stock. o To advise on scenarios on production schedule whenever there is constraint such as no material. so To ensure packaging and raw material are available for planning purpose forward looking based on the planning horizon.o To calculate scenarios whenever change in SKU and pack type for S&OP process.o Shall be responsible to update and provide inventory check for continuous flow of materials for Packaging and Sales based Planning, Rough-cut Capacity Checks, and Master Production Planningo Is responsible for optimizing the balance of inventory in line with target customer service levels, levels of forecast accuracy and safety stock levels for the portfolio of SKUs for which they are accountable. o Regular updates with procurement section and suppliers on supply needs; and to highlight any gaps o Responsible to set the correct levels of inventory (safety stocks) within the supply plan by understanding the demand volatility and supply chain lead times
Job Requirement: o Bachelor's degree of Business or in Logistics & Supply Chain Management or relevant fieldso At least 3-5 years’ experience in Supply Planning and Inventory management in FMCG environmento Able to operate and used excel and any other planning toolso Good understanding of Planning, Analysis and Report Writing with knowledge of Best Planning & Logistics practices

Job Description:
-Ensure daily operations are completed as per procedures
-Well co-ordinate with Sale team, CS team & invoicing team to make sure whole process is properly followed
-Handle documentation for SEA/AIR Freight Import/Export shipments including main jobs below:
1. Follow up working guideline given by customer, partner.
2. Coordinate with oversea partners to work smoothly.
3. Search for new and potential forwarder and service provider/ broker then negotiate for best prices and other commercial conditions.
4. Back up jobs for other documentation staffs or OP manager when necessary.
5. Report special cases/ troubles and work result to OP manager and President.
6.  Ensure to understand Cambodia labor laws and companies/ department policies/ regulations are followed.
Job Requirement:
- Preferred MANDARIN Language.
- At least 3 Years of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
- Good at English (Reading & Writing), basic in communication.
- Good at Internet, MS Office (Excel, Word, Power Point).
- Good skill of Interpersonal communication and Customer Service.
- Ability to work under pressure and have good team work and regular job rotation spirit.
- Good with figures, responsible, careful, detail-oriented, dynamic and hard-working Own transportation.
Company Profile:
Evergreen Logistics Corp is a member of the Evergreen Group established by Dr. Yung-Fa Chang on 1 September 1968 in Taiwan. We provide freight forwarding, logistics operations, customs brokerage, warehousing and distribution, project shipment, advanced IT platforms and customized total solutions － all with value-added services.

ELC have 42 own branches offices and have a very intensive network around the world. The experienced and professional team of our own offices in Taiwan, Mainland China, Southeast Asia , India & United States as well as agents in North East Asia, the Europe, the Mediterranean, Australia, and Africa provides our valuable business partner with the most cost-effective and time-critical solutions. Via a single platform, our worldwide IT solutions provide real-time data to customers wherever they are in the world.

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.
Contact Info: Contact Information Recruitment and Job Management  092333020 jobs@amret.com.kh #80, Street 315, Sangkat Boeung Kak2, Khan Toul Kok, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 092333020

Job Description:
•	Assist SVP/Head of Business banking to manage the relationship with business and VIP (Preferred) clients.
•	Make regular contact and visit by ensuring the client needs is met.
•	Build-in Preferred/Business Deposit in Normal and Term Deposit
•	Anticipate clients' needs and provide client solutions for both liability and asset business proactively.
•	Ensure close asset monitoring in compliance with bank's policies and systems.
•	Develop action plans to acquire, retain and grow clients.
•	Anticipate and resolve internal hurdles with a sense of urgency and consistency.
•	Promote the use of technology in line with the bank's digital-centric first strategy.
•	Promote the use of other products within the bank
•	Maximize customer profitability through the CRM platform.
•	Ensure to deliver the service to the client with a respectful timeline.
Job Requirement:
•	At least Bachelor’s degree in business management or other related fields
•	A minimum of 4 years experience in the banking sector, preferably in preferred banking/priority banking
•	Have strong problem solving, analytical, and decision-making ability.
•	Have experiences and/or understanding of customer centricity, agile delivery, etc.
•	Have an internal drive to achieve goals/excellence/efficiencies.
•	Intrapreneurship with good networking
•	Have a strong pipeline in hand.
Company Profile: Since its founding in 1982, Chip Mong has focused extensively on the changing needs of the society and the strengthening of its relationships with business communities, both domestically and internationally. In recent years, Chip Mong has experienced tremendous growth and evolved into one of the largest groups of companies in the country, comprising seven wholly-owned subsidies, three joint-ventures, and two hotel projects. Chip Mong’s businesses include construction and materials, consumers goods, property development, beverages, general industrials, hospitality, retail and feed. The Company also offers a vast array of consumer products from well-known manufacturers throughout the region.

Job Description:
• Work with commercial functions and support them to insure timely, relevant and reasonable budgets (sales, prices, discounts, commercial expenses) with sufficient details. Consolidation of planed reports and key-in to local ERP system
• Budgeting Plan and forecast profitability reports preparation (SKU/Brands/Category/Regions etc.)
• Accruals preparation with commercial functions (discounts and commercial expenses)
• Support the business planning cycle of Supply Chain within the assigned units for the Strategic Plan, Final Budget and Latest Estimates
• Lead and coordinate the analysis of internal and external Supply Chain movements / benchmarks, and forecast future supply chain trends and impact on the business
• Provide advice and guidance, and influence/strengthen decision making in Supply Chain. Lead analysis to provide the financial impact of Supply Chain decisions affecting the P&L
• Monitor and develop insight on the quantitative and qualitative performance of the Supply Chain department, and communicate this insight through the preparation and delivery of streamlined reporting including commentary
• Act as a key part of the decision-making process for Supply Chain decisions (investments, divestments, procurement agreements). Lead projects within the operation, related to Capex and post audits
Job Requirement:
• 1-2 Years’ experience 
• BBA
• Analyzing, finance partnering technic skill to influent stakeholder.  
• ERP and Microsoft Excel Advance
• English

Job Description:

- Collaborate with lawyers and law enforcement agents to develop and execute plans for the resolution of a fraud case.

- Proffer professional recommendations to business establishments on techniques necessary for limiting risk of fraud.
- Design and implement processes effective for the prevention or minimization of fraud risks
- Maintain record of all investigative operations and results of analysis
- Investigators to analyze cases of winners and legal claims.
- Oversee the designation of work territories to team members according to their specialization and capacity.
- Ensure compliance with all laid down policies and procedures for work operations.
- Design and implement fraud prevention strategies and processes necessary for minimizing the risk of illegal operation contrivances within an organization.

- At least 3 years of work experience in Audit, Accounting and finance or any related fields.
- High self-confident and matured individual with strong self-discipline.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Flexible to travel.

Job Description: - Manage and support Account Receivables (AR) by reviewing AR Aging and collections on daily basis- Manage and support Account Payables (AP) by reviewing the details AP Invoices against with supporting documents and ensure the completeness, existence, and accuracy of the expenses- Perform details review on expenses raised by AP team to ensure the correct classification and accuracy of the records- Coordinate, support, and prepare payment to suppliers (if needed) to make sure that the payments are made by the due date- Check and review in details on payments and ensure that they are made in accordance with the contract agreement and internal policy- Review and ensure that all transactions are correctly posted in the system and on timely fashion- Review and Report AR and AP Balances, cash collections and payments on daily, weekly and monthly basis- Support AR team and Coordinate with related departments to solve any AR related issues to ensure the collections is by the due date- Perform bank reconciliation and GL Account reconciliations to ensure the accuracy of the balances- Perform cost allocation in system on monthly basis- Review and file monthly and annual tax return and complete E-filing and E-VAT- Assist Accounting Manager or Head of Finance in preparing accounting policies and procedures- Lead and support on monthly stock take and report to Finance Manager or Head of Finance- Review Fixed Assets register, calculate depreciations, and coordinate with related department on fixed assets count- Coaching and mentoring direct reports- Other assignments from Finance Manager or Head of Finance.
Job Requirement: - University graduate, major in Accounting and Finance is preferred- Pursuing ACCA or completed CAT is a plus- Minimum of 3 years’ working experiences in related field- Prior experiences with Borey or real estate is a plus- Advance in Ms. Excel and experienced with ERP system- Strong analytical and logical reasoning skills- Ability to work under pressure- Strong presentation, written communication, and report-writing skills in English and Khmer
Company Profile: The Mekong Land Development co.,Ltd is one of the Domestic Investment Companies that build and sell modern, quality and harmonious houses and residence with a combination of Western and Khmer styles in form so-call "Borey'' to our valued customers. We currently serve Flat house, Link Houses, Shop house... Due to we are growing and expanding operation.

job title: ប្រធានក្រុម HSE (HSE Supervisor) 1 Post
position: ប្រធានក្រុម HSE (HSE Supervisor) 1 Post
Job Description:
• ប្រធានក្រុម HSE (HSE Supervisor) មានតួនាទី បង្កើត ឬអនុវត្តន៍គោលការណ៍ HSE, បង្កើត ឬអនុវត្តន៍ស្ដង់ដារប្រតិបត្តិការ HSE, ធ្វើតេស្ដសាកល្បងនូវទម្រង់បែបបទ HSE នានា, សហការបង្កើតវគ្គបណ្ដុះបណ្ដាល HSE, ចុះត្រួតពិនិត្យការងារ HSEនៅការដ្ឋានឱ្យបានទៀងទាត់, ដឹកនាំសកម្មភាពទាក់ទងនឹង HSE, ធានាក្នុងការអនុវត្តន៍ការងារ HSE យ៉ាងខ្ជាប់ខ្ជួន, បង្កើតវគ្គបណ្ដុះបណ្ដាលការពារហានិយភ័យ, ចុះពិនិត្យ និងកែតម្រូវការងារ HSE, ចូលរួមប្រជុំ HSE ជាប្រចាំសប្ដាហ៍, ចូលរួមចំណែកជាមួយសវនករ, ចុះ Spot Check គ្រឿងចក្រ, សម្របសម្រួលយុទ្ធនាការសម្អាតនានា, ផ្ដល់យោបល់ឱ្យផ្អាកការងារពេលឃើញចំនុចប្រឈមហានិភ័យ, បង្កើតកម្មវិធីបង្ការហានិភ័យ, ធ្វើរបាយការណ៍ប្រចាំសប្ដាហ៍, ដឹកនាំស៊ើបអង្កេតករណីគ្រោះថ្នាក់ការងារ, កំណត់ផែនការអាទិភាពការងារណាដែលប្រឈមនឹងហានិភ័យខ្ពស់ ។

** JOB RESPONSIBILITY
•	បង្កើត ឬអនុវត្តន៍ គោលការណ៍ HSE មួយដែលល្អ, អាចអនុវត្តន៍បាន, សមស្របទៅតាមស្ថានភាព ឬកាលៈទេសៈជាក់ស្ដែង របស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន មេគង្គលែន ដើម្បីអនុវត្តន៍ឱ្យមានគុណភាព និងប្រសិទ្ធភាពខ្ពស់ ។
•	បង្កើត ឬអនុវត្តន៍ ស្ដង់ដារប្រតិបត្តិការ HSE ដែលមានចែងលម្អិតផ្សេងៗគ្នា ទៅតាមប្រភេទការងារនីមួយៗ ដើម្បីឱ្យប្រតិបត្តិករ ងាយយល់ និងអនុវត្តន៍ឱ្យមានគុណភាព និងប្រសិទ្ធភាពខ្ពស់ ជៀសវាងកំហុសដោយអចេតនា ។
•	ធ្វើតេស្ដសាកល្បងនូវរាល់ទម្រង់បែបបទនានា ដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹង HSE ដើម្បីធនានូវគុណភាព និងភាពល្អិតល្អន់នៃព័ត៌មាន ប្រសិទ្ធភាពនៃការប្រើប្រាស់ទម្រង់ផងដែរ ។
•	សហការជាមួយផ្នែកធនធានមនុស្ស និងរដ្ឋបាល, ផ្នែកបច្ចេកទេស និងផ្នែកផ្សេងដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធ ដើម្បីបង្កើតវគ្គបណ្ដុះបណ្ដាលដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹងការងារ HSE ពិសេសវិស្វករការដ្ឋាន អ្នកម៉ៅការ និងជាង ។ 
•	ចុះត្រួតពិនិត្យគម្រោង/ការរដ្ឋាន ឱ្យបានទៀងទាត់ លើប្រតិបត្តិករការដ្ឋានមានវិស្វករ អ្នកម៉ៅការ និងជាង ដើម្បីធ្វើឱ្យប្រាកដថា គោលការណ៍ HSE ត្រូវបានអនុវត្តន៍ដោយយកចិត្តទុកដាក់ និងប្រសិទ្ធភាពបំផុត ។
•	ដឹកនាំសកម្មភាពនានាដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹង HSE ជាមួយវិស្វករការដ្ឋាន, អ្នកម៉ៅការ, និងជាង ដោយមានការវិភាគនូវចំនុចខ្វះខាត, ចំនុចដែលត្រូវកែតម្រូវ ដើម្បីបង្ការ និងការពារ គ្រោះថ្នាក់ផ្សេងៗដែលអាចកើតមានជាយថាហេតុ ។
•	ធានាឱ្យបាននូវគុណភាព និងប្រសិទ្ធភាព នៃនីតិវិធីនានារបស់ HSE, គោលការណ៍នៃសុវត្ថិភាពបុគ្គល និងបរិស្ថាន នៅគម្រោង/ការដ្ឋានជាក់ស្ដែង ។
•	បង្កើតការបណ្ដុះបណ្ដាលលើការការពារហានិភ័យ ដើម្បីធានាឱ្យបាននូវលក្ខខណ្ឌនៅកន្លែងការងារ ដោយជៀសបានពីគ្រោះថ្នាក់នានា, ការប្រើប្រាស់សម្ភារៈតាមបច្ចេកទេស និងបរិស្ថានល្អប្រសើរ ។
•	ចុះត្រួតពិនិត្យ និងកែតម្រូវ ចំនុច ឬសកម្មភាព ឬស្ថានភាព ដែលអាចបង្ករគ្រោះថ្នាក់ នៅកន្លែងការងារផ្ទាល់ ។
•	ធ្វើផែនការ និងចូលរួមប្រជុំ (Toolbox Meeting) ជាប្រចាំនៅការដ្ឋានជាមួយវិស្វករ, អ្នកម៉ៅការ, ជាង ដើម្បីពង្រីកការយល់ដឹង និងជម្រុញការអនុវត្តន៍ការងារ HSE បានល្អប្រសើរ ។
•	ដាក់ផែនការចុះត្រួតពិនិត្យ (Spot Check) រថយន្ត, គ្រឿងចក្រ, ឧបករណ៍, សម្ភារៈ, បំពង់ និងឧបករណ៍ពន្លត់អគ្គីភ័យ, ជណ្ដើរយន្ត, ឡានស្ទួច (Cranes), ។ល។
•	រៀបចំ និងសម្របសម្រួលក្នុងយុទ្ធនាការសម្អាត, អនាម័យ, កម្មវិធីលើកទឹកចិត្តសុវត្ថិភាព ដើម្បីឱ្យមានការចូលរួមដ៏ផុសផុល និងយកចិត្តទុកដាក់ លើការងារសុវត្ថិភាព និងអនាម័យ ។
•	ផ្ដល់យោបល់ និងចេញបញ្ជា ឱ្យផ្អាក ឬពន្យាការងារ ឬសកម្មភាពណាមួយជាបន្ទាន់ បន្ទាប់ពីរកឃើញថាសកម្មភាពនោះមានផលប៉ះពាល់ដល់សុវត្ថិភាពបុគ្គល និងបរិស្ថាន ។
•	ចូលរួមជាមួយប្រធានការដ្ឋាន ឬប្រធានគម្រោង បង្កើតកម្មវិធីត្រួតពិនិត្យ និងបង្ការហានិភ័យនានា ។
•	ធ្វើរបាយការណ៍ប្រចាំសប្ដាហ៍, ប្រចាំខែ, ប្រចាំឆ្នាំ ពីការងារ HSE ជូនប្រធានគម្រោង ។
•	ដឹកនាំសកម្មភាពស៊ើបអង្កេតគ្រោះថ្នាក់/ឧប្បត្តិវហេតុ ដែលកើតមាន រួចធើ្វរបាយការណ៍ និងដោះស្រាយ បន្ទាប់មកធ្វើការវិភាគ ពីមូលហេតុ ដើម្បីកែតម្រូវ និងបង្ការ មិនឱ្យកើតមានទៀត ។
•	កំណត់អាទិភាពការងារដោយផ្តោតសំខាន់លើការងារបង្ការហានិភ័យ ដូចជា ៖ ការធ្លាក់មនុស្សពីលើអគារ, ការធ្លាក់សម្ភារៈ, ការយោងសម្ភារៈ, ការប្រើប្រាស់ឧបករណ៍ការពារអគ្គិសនីឆក់, សុវត្ថិភាពតាមដងផ្លូវក្នុងគម្រោង ។ល។
•	ការងារផ្សេងទៀតត្រូវបានដាក់ជូនដោយប្រធានគម្រោង ។
Job Requirement:
•	បញ្ចប់ថ្នាក់បរិញ្ញាប័ត្រផ្នែកសំណង់ស៊ីវិល និងជំនាញដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធដែលមានតម្លៃស្មើ ។
•	មានបទពិសោធន៍ការងារយ៉ាងតិច 3ឆ្នាំ លើតួនាទី HSE ឬ សវនករ ។
•	មានជំនាញបន្ថែមលើការងារដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធ MS. Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Internet, AutoCAD ។
•	មានសមត្ថភាពធ្វើការងារជាក្រុម និង មានទំនាក់ទំនងល្អ ។
•	មានភាពស្មោះត្រង់ និងទំនួលខុសត្រូវក្នុងការងារខ្ពស់ ។
•	ទំនាក់ទំនងល្អជាមួយបុគ្គលិកក្រុមហ៊ុនទាំងថ្នាក់លើ និង ថ្នាក់ក្រោម ។
Company Profile: The Mekong Land Development co.,Ltd is one of the Domestic Investment Companies that build and sell modern, quality and harmonious houses and residence with a combination of Western and Khmer styles in form so-call "Borey'' to our valued customers. We currently serve Flat house, Link Houses, Shop house... Due to we are growing and expanding operation.

Job Description:
_Complete credit proposal form with relevant documents and recommend ensuring that debts are monitored and collected following credit terms
_Understand market trends by collecting all market information and suggestions to improve sales
_Resolves customer complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, preparing reports, and making recommendations to management
_Perform other duties as assigned
Job Requirement:
_High School and above (bachelor’s degree is an advantage)
_1-year experience in marketing, promotions, advertising sales, or business administration preferred
_Knowledge of related specific products is a plus
_Highly self-motivated
_Strong verbal and written communication skills
_Able to travel within the assigned area and holding a driving license is a plus
_Customer service
_Good negotiation skill
_Presentation skill
_Attention to detail
Company Profile: Since its founding in 1982, Chip Mong has focused extensively on the changing needs of the society and the strengthening of its relationships with business communities, both domestically and internationally. In recent years, Chip Mong has experienced tremendous growth and evolved into one of the largest groups of companies in the country, comprising seven wholly-owned subsidies, three joint-ventures, and two hotel projects. Chip Mong’s businesses include construction and materials, consumers goods, property development, beverages, general industrials, hospitality, retail and feed. The Company also offers a vast array of consumer products from well-known manufacturers throughout the region.
